The incident in question occurred on October 07, 2025 at Narra Hall, where you currently reside as a registered dormitory student. VIOLATION DETAILS: Campus Security and Dormitory Staff have reported the following policy infractions: failure to maintain cleanliness standards resulting in health and safety concerns. These actions are expressly prohibited under Section 8 of the University Residential Life Handbook. INVESTIGATION SUMMARY: A thorough investigation was conducted by the Dormitory Disciplinary Board, including review of security footage, interviews with dormitory residents and staff, and examination of your written statement submitted on October 14, 2025. HOUSING SANCTIONS: Effective immediately, the following residential sanctions are imposed: written warning to be placed in your housing file, restriction trom dormitory common areas for 4 weeks, mandatory attendance at the Residential Life Responsibility Workshop, payment of fines and damages totaling 2 871 00, and probationary housing status. BEHAVIORAL EXPECTATIONS: During your probationary period, you must maintain exemplary conduct and strict adherence to all dormitory policies. This includes observance of quiet hours (10 00 PM to 6 00 AM), compliance with visitor policies, and cooperation with dormitory staff. REHABILITATION REQUIREMENTS: You are required to meet bi weekly with the Residential Life Coordinator and complete 60 hours of dormitory community service. FINANCIAL ACCOUNTABILITY: Payment of 2 871 00 must be made to the University Cashier s Office within fifteen (15) days. Failure to settle will result in a hold on your student account. Your signature acknowledges receipt of this notice and your commitment to fulfilling all imposed sanctions. Respectfully submitted, ANTONIO JOSE M. ocr_text: UNIVERSITY OF THE PHILIPPINES DILIMAN Office of the Vice Chancellor for Student Affairs STUDENT CODE OF CONDUCT AGREEMENT Dear Student, This acknowledgement form serves to officially document a violation of academic integrity standards as defined by the university s policies on scholarly conduct. The Academic Integrity Committee has completed its investigation into allegations regarding your submitted requirements for ENG 101 English Composition and Rhetoric. FINDING OF RESPONSIBILITY: Based on substantial evidence including plagiarism detection software results and testimony from the course instructor, Dr. Richard Tanner, the committee finds that you are responsible for academic dishonesty: use of unauthorized materials and electronic devices during examinations. This constitutes a serious breach of academic trust. ACADEMIC PENALTY: The following academic sanctions are hereby imposed: a grade of ZERO (0) for the submitted requirement, a reduction of one full letter grade in the final course grade, mandatory completion of the Academic Integrity Seminar, and a formal notation on your academic transcript. FUTURE IMPLICATIONS This violation will remain part of your permanent academic record. Any subsequent violation will result in more severe penalties including automatic failure in the course, suspension from the university, or permanent dismissal EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS: You must complete attendance at three (3) sessions of the Academic integrity Workshop conducted by the Teaching and Learning Center and submit a comprehensive research paper on the importance of academic honesty. PROBATIONARY STATUS: You are hereby placed on Academic Integrity Probation for one (1) full academic year. During this period, all your submitted academic work may be subject to enhanced scrutiny. Your signature below confirms that you have read understood, and accept responsibility for this violation and its consequences. Sincerely, JOSE EMMANUEL C REYES, PhD Chair, Academic integrity Committee JANET HUNT ‘Student Number: 2023 74267 ‘SIGNATURE OVER PRINTED NAME OF STUDENT Date November 17, 2025 Faculty Colleae School institute Contact Number: 09719227244 School of Economics Attested: MICHAEL HERMAN SIGNATURE OVER PRINTED NAME OF PARENT GUARDIAN Date: November 20, 2025 INSTRUCTIONS Kindy print and submit this form to the Office of the Dean

ocr_text: DE LA SALLE UNIVERSITY 2401 Taft Avenue, Mania 1004, Metro Mania MEMORANDUM OF AGREEMENT ACKNOWLEDGEMENT Date: November 03, 2025 Dear Vice President for Academic Affairs George Thomas, This letter serves to formally acknowledge and confirm our institution s acceptance of the Partnership Agreement with Bicol University for the implementation of the “Technology Transfer and Innovation Hub” initiative. We are honored to collaborate with your esteemed institution in this important endeavor. The partnership agreement, which shall be effective for a period of 4 years, establishes a comprehensive framework for cooperation in curriculum development, faculty exchange, research collaboration, and ‘community extension programs. Our institution fully endorses the objectives and terms outlined in the agreement and commits to fulfilling all obligations in good faith. Both parties agree to the following key responsibilities: provision of qualified faculty and staff for program implementation, allocation of necessary resources and facilities, joint planning and coordination of activities, regular communication and progress reporting, and compliance with all applicable laws, regulations, and institutional policies. This partnership aligns with our institution s strategic priorities and reinforces our commitment to providing quality education and promoting academic excellence. We anticipate that this collaboration will yield significant benefits for our students, faculty, and the broader academic community. We express our sincere appreciation for the opportunity to partner with Bicol University and look forward to a successful and enduring collaboration. Our team is prepared to commence work on the agreed activities immediately upon finalization of all administrative requirements. Should you have any questions or concems, please do not hesitate to contact our office at your earliest convenience. Respectfully yours, MATTHEW CRAWFORD Authorized Signature MATTHEW CRAWFORD Dean, Graduate School Print Name and Title November 05, 2025 Date RECEIVED AND ACKNOWLEDGED Page 1 of 1

ocr_text: DE LA SALLE UNIVERSITY 2401 Taft Avenue, Mania 1004, Metro Manila RESEARCH COLLABORATION ACKNOWLEDGEMENT ee Date: November 08, 2025 Dear University President Judith Savage, We write to formally acknowledge receipt and acceptance of the Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) executed between DE LA SALLE UNIVERSITY and Visayas State University regarding "Faculty Development and Capacity Building Program’. This agreement represents a significant step forward in fostering institutional collaboration and advancing our shared educational mission. The MOU establishes the terms and conditions for cooperation in various academic and research activities over the period from November 26, 2025 to January 14, 2027. Our institution affirms its commitment to the principles and objectives outlined in this agreement and pledges to work diligently toward their achievement. Principal areas of collaboration include: joint curriculum development and program articulation, student and facuity mobility programs, collaborative research projects and scholarly publications, sharing of library and laboratory facilities, joint conferences and academic symposia, and community extension and outreach activities. Both institutions agree to provide necessary support and resources for successful implementation. This partnership offers tremendous opportunities for enhancing the quality of ‘education, expanding research capabilities, and creating valuable learning experiences for our students. We are confident that through mutual cooperation and shared commitment, this collaboration will yield positive outcomes for both institutions and contribute to the advancement of Philippine higher education. We appreciate the spirit of cooperation demonstrated throughout the negotiation process and look forward to building a strong and productive partnership. Our institution stands ready to begin implementation of the agreed programs and activities, Thank you for your continued support and collaboration. Very truly yours, TIMOTHY HERNANDEZ Authorized Signature TIMOTHY HERNANDEZ Vice President for Academic Affairs Print Name and Title November 10, 2025 Date ACCEPTED AND APPROVED Page 1 of 1

The MOU establishes the terms and conditions for cooperation in various academic and research activities over the period from November 26, 2025 to January 14, 2027. Our institution affirms its commitment to the principles and objectives outlined in this agreement and pledges to work diligently toward their achievement. Principal areas of collaboration include: joint curriculum development and program articulation, student and faculty mobility programs, collaborative research projects and scholarly publications, sharing of library and laboratory faclties, joint conferences and academic symposia, and community extension and outreach activities. This partnership offers tremendous opportunities for enhancing the quality of ‘education, expanding research capabilities, and creating valuable leaming experiences for our students. We are confident that through mutual cooperation and shared commitment, this collaboration will yield positive outcomes for both institutions and contribute to the advancement of Philippine higher education. We appreciate the spirit of cooperation demonstrated throughout the negotiation process and look forward to building ‘a strong and productive partnership. Our institution stands ready to begin implementation of the agreed programs and activities. Thank you for your continued support and collaboration. Very truly yours, TIMOTHY HERNANDEZ. ocr_text: UNIVERSITY OF SANTO TOMAS Espafia Boulevard, Mania 1015, Metro Manila MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING CONFIRMATION Date: November 04, 2025 Dear Vice President for Research and Development Sheila Thompson, This letter serves to formally acknowledge and confirm our institution s acceptance of the Partnership Agreement with Central Luzon State University for the implementation of the "Library and Resource Sharing Agreement" initiative. We are honored to collaborate with your esteemed institution in this important endeavor. The partnership agreement, which shall be effective for a period of 5 years, establishes a comprehensive framework for cooperation in curriculum development, faculty exchange, research collaboration, and community extension programs. Our institution fully endorses the objectives and terms outlined in the agreement and commits to fuffiling all obligations in good faith. Both parties agree to the following key responsibilties: provision of qualified faculty and staff for program implementation, allocation of necessary resources and facilites, joint planning and coordination of activities, regular communication and progress reporting, and compliance with all applicable laws, regulations, and institutional policies. This partnership aligns with our institution s strategic priorities and reinforces our commitment to providing quality education and promoting academic excellence. We anticipate that this collaboration will yield significant benefits for our students, faculty, and the broader academic community. We express our sincere appreciation for the opportunity to partner with Central Luzon State University and look forward to a successful and enduring collaboration. Our team is prepared to commence work on the agreed activities immediately upon finalization of all administrative requirements. Should you have any questions or concems, please do not hesitate to contact our office at your earliest convenience. Respectfully yours, MICHAEL BROWN Authorized Signature MICHAEL BROWN Director, International Affairs Office Print Name and Title November 04, 2025 Date ACKNOWLEDGED AND ACCEPTED Page 1 of 1

Mesa, Manila 1016, Metro Manila MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING CONFIRMATION Date: November 11, 2025 Dear Vice President for Academic Affairs lan Marsh, We write to formally acknowledge receipt and acceptance of the Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) executed between POLYTECHNIC UNIVERSITY OF THE PHILIPPINES and University of Southeastem Philippines regarding "Student Exchange and Mobility Initiative”. This agreement represents a significant step forward in fostering institutional collaboration and advancing our shared educational mission. The MOU establishes the terms and conditions for cooperation in various academic and research activities over the period from December 19, 2025 to October 06, 2027. Our institution affirms its commitment to the principles and objectives outlined in this agreement and pledges to work diligently toward their achievement. Principal areas of collaboration include: joint curriculum development and program articulation, student and faculty mobility programs, collaborative research projects and scholarly publications, sharing of library and laboratory facilities, joint conferences and academic symposia, and community extension and outreach activities. Both institutions agree to provide necessary support and resources for successful implementation. This partnership offers tremendous ‘opportunities for enhancing the quality of education, expanding research capabilities, and creating valuable leaming experiences for our students. We are confident that through mutual cooperation and shared commitment, this collaboration will yield positive outcomes for both institutions and contribute to the advancement of Philippine higher education. We appreciate the spirit of cooperation demonstrated throughout the negotiation process and look forward to building a strong and productive partnership. Our institution stands ready to begin implementation of the agreed programs and activities. Thank you for your continued support and collaboration. Very truly yours, JOHN HUFFMAN Authorized Signature JOHN HUFFMAN Director, International Affairs Office Print Name and Title November 11 2025 Date RECEIVED AND ACKNOWLEDGED Page 1 of 1
